fact: The Great Wall of China is the longest wall in the world, stretching over 13,000 miles.
A group of unicorns is called a "blessing."
The ancient Egyptians used honey as a natural sweetener, and it was also used as a form of currency.
The average human produces enough saliva in their lifetime to fill a swimming pool.
The first recorded use of the word "computer" was in 1613 and referred to a person who performed calculations.
The tallest building in the world is actually a giant tree in the Amazon rainforest.
The shortest reigning monarch in history was King Louis XIX of France, who ruled for just 20 minutes.
The planet Jupiter has over 1,000 moons.
The first recorded Olympic games were held in ancient Greece in 776 BC.
The world's largest pizza was made in Antarctica and was 10 miles long.
